intro: Euodia schullei f. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered euodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rutaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly serrated margin. Native to southern Africa, this plant typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. The plant has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
